page.title: 09RIVER DON INVERURIE
page.content:
The Stanners is the name of the piece of ground formed between the junction of the Rivers Don and Urie. Further along the Urie stands the Bass, which is a sand and gravel hill formed by the action of the river in geoglogical times.
The remains of a former canal can be seen near the Inverurie Bridge. This canal was built in the 18th century to convey goods from Inverurie to Aberdeen before the road was built and before the coming of the railway.
Two mills used the waters of the Don. There was a Meal Mill, which stood near the canal, and a Paper Mill. Only the Paper Mill remains today and it is a very modern mill using modern technology.
